data.name: Help_CmdLineArguments
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineBooleanOperators
data.value: /bo [True/False] -bo [True/False] -booleanOperators [True/False] Sets the Boolean operators search flag – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineCaseSensitive
data.value: /cs [True/False] -cs [True/False] -caseSensitive [True/False] Sets case-sensitive search flag – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineCSVReport
data.value: /csv [filePath] -csv [filePath] Create results file in CSV format after search is complete.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineDefaultArguments
data.value: Any arguments not specified will default to the last saved user settings.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineDotAsNewline
data.value: /dn [True/False] -dn [True/False] -dotAsNewline [True/False] Sets the dot as newline search flag – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineExample1
data.value: dnGrep [arguments] Using any combination of arguments from the list below. Example: dnGrep /f "C:\Program Files\dnGrep" /pm *.txt;*.xml /s t\w*t /st Regex
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineExample2
data.value: dnGrep [folderPath] [searchFor] One or two arguments without flags: the first argument is the folder to search, the second the regular expression to search for. Example: dnGrep "C:\Program Files\dnGrep" t\w*t
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineExit
data.value: /x -x -exit Exit dnGrep after command-line operations are complete.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineFileInformation
data.value: /fi [True/False] -fi [True/False] -fileInformation [True/False] Sets flag to include file and line information in the report output – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineFolder
data.value: /f [folderPath] -f [folderPath] -folder [folderPath] Sets the folder path to search. May be a comma- or semicolon-separated list of folder paths.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineHeader
data.value: dnGrep: Search through text files, Word and Excel documents, PDFs, and archives using text, regular expression, XPath, and phonetic queries.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineListItemSeparator
data.value: /sep [separator character or text] -sep [separator character or text] -listItemSeparator [separator character or text] Sets the character or string to separate list items on a line in the report output.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineMultiline
data.value: /ml [True/False] -ml [True/False] -multiline [True/False] Sets the multiline search flag – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLinePathToIgnore
data.value: /pi [pattern] -pi [pattern] -pathToIgnore [pattern] Sets the file or directory name pattern to exclude files or folders in the search path. May be a comma- or semicolon-separated list of patterns.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLinePathToMatch
data.value: /pm [pattern] -pm [pattern] -pathToMatch [pattern] Sets the file name pattern to match files in the search path. May be a comma- or semicolon-separated list of patterns.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLinePatternType
data.value: /pt [type] -pt [type] -patternType [type] Sets the type of match and ignore pattern – must be one of: "Asterisk" (wildcard), "Regex" (regular expression), or "Everything" (if the Everything search tool is installed).
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineReport
data.value: /rpt [filePath] -rpt [filePath] -report [filePath] Create results file in report format after search is complete.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineReportMode
data.value: /rm [mode] -rm [mode] -reportMode [mode] Sets the report output mode for regular expression reports - must be one of: "FullLine", "Matches", or "Groups".
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineScript
data.value: /sc [scriptKey] -sc [scriptKey] -script [scriptKey] Runs the script identified by the script key.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineSearchFor
data.value: /s [searchFor] -s [searchFor] -searchFor [searchFor] Sets the pattern or text to search for within the set of files. When this argument is set, the search will be run automatically.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineSearchType
data.value: /st [type] -st [type] -searchType [type] Sets the type of search – must be one of: "PlainText", "Regex" (regular expression), "XPath", or "Soundex" (phonetic).
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineSeparateLines
data.value: /sl [True/False] -sl [True/False] -separateLines [True/False] Sets flag to output each match or group on a separate line in the regular expression report output – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineTextReport
data.value: /txt [filePath] -txt [filePath] -text [filePath] Create results file in text format after search is complete.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineTrimWhitespace
data.value: /trim [True/False] -trim [True/False] -trimWhitespace [True/False] Sets flag to trim whitespace in the report output – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineUniqueScope
data.value: /scope [scope] -scope [scope] -uniqueScope [scope] Sets flag to set the scope of unique values in the regular expression report output – must be one of: "Global" or "PerFile".
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineUniqueValues
data.value: /unique [True/False] -unique [True/False] -uniqueValues [True/False] Sets flag to output unique match or group values in the regular expression report output – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineUsage
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line

data.name: Help_CmdLineVersion
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line: {0} is the installed dnGrep version number; {1} is the installed dnGrep build date

data.name: Help_CmdLineWholeWord
data.value: /ww [True/False] -ww [True/False] -wholeWord [True/False] Sets the whole word search flag – True or False.
data.comment: Help dialog text when running dnGrep from the command-line
